stem: A 45-year-old client with a traumatic brain injury (TBI) is in the ICU. Based on the documentation, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute deterioration in neurological status.
Background: TBI with right-sided subdural hematoma.
Assessment: ICP has risen from 18 to 35 mmHg in the last 15 minutes. Client is now non-responsive to verbal commands.
Recommendation: Immediate decompression measures required.

tabs.title: Neurological Assessment & ICP Metrics
tabs.content:
Assessment14:00 Findings14:15 Findings (Now)
ICP (mmHg)1835
GCS12 (E3, V4, M5)6 (E1, V1, M4)
Pupils3mm BRLR: 6mm Fixed/Dilated; L: 3mm Brisk
Motor ResponseLocalizes to painDecerebrate posturing (Extension)

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 192/68 mmHg (Widening pulse pressure), HR 48 bpm (Bradycardia), RR 10 breaths/min (Irregular/Cheyne-Stokes).

actionOptions.text: Hyperventilate the client via ventilator to PaCO2 30â€“35 mmHg
Avoid or strictly limit tracheal suctioning to 10 seconds
Keep the head of the bed (HOB) flat to improve cerebral perfusion
Administer aggressive IV fluid boluses for hypotension

parameterOptions.text: Urinary output for signs of SIADH

rationale.correct: The client is showing a 'blown pupil' (Right 6mm fixed), Cushing's triad (HTN, Bradycardia, irregular RR), and decerebrate posturing, all indicative of brain herniation (c2). Priority actions include emergency hyperventilation (a1) to cause cerebral vasoconstriction (lowering volume) and avoiding activities that increase pressure like suctioning (a2). Monitoring motor response (p1) and ABGs (p2) is vital to evaluate intervention efficacy.
clinicalPearls: PaCO2 is a potent vasodilator. Lowering CO2 = Vasoconstriction = More room for the brain.
Hyperventilation is a TEMPORARY 'rescue' measure, not a long-term strategy.
Fixed and dilated pupils indicate herniation onto the 3rd cranial nerve.

questionTrap.trap: Keeping HOB flat in an ICP crisis.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Flat is for spine/BP. ICP requires HOB 30 degrees to promote venous drainage. If they are herniating, never go flat.

mnemonic.title: Cushing's Triad
mnemonic.expansion: Up Blood Pressure (Widening). Down Heart Rate. Down Respiratory Rate.
